items.title: Fire ant venom compounds may lead to skin treatments
items.summary: Solenopsins, the main toxic components of fire ant venom, chemically resemble ceramides, which are lipid-like molecules essential for maintaining for the barrier function of the skin. Solenopsin analogs can reduce skin thickening and inflammation in a mouse model of psoriasis, scientists have shown.

alternate.title: Fire ant venom compounds may lead to skin treatments

thumbnail.title: Fire ant venom compounds may lead to skin treatments

items.title: Desert locusts: New risks in the light of climate change
items.summary: The desert locust is an invasive species that is both well known and feared because of the large-scale agricultural damage it can cause. It is particularly closely monitored, to prevent the risks of outbreaks and invasions. Climate change could modify its distribution area, meaning a new threat to agriculture, according to a study.

alternate.title: Desert locusts: New risks in the light of climate change

thumbnail.title: Desert locusts: New risks in the light of climate change

items.title: Biosensor detects adulteration of horse in beef meat within one hour
items.summary: Fraud in meat products has become, in recent years, a battle of the food industry and public health. Although there are numerous strategies to detect it, they are not sufficiently selective and sensitive to differentiate close animal species. A collaboration of experts has developed an electrochemical biosensor capable of detecting, in just one hour, processes of adulteration of beef with horse meat.

alternate.title: Biosensor detects adulteration of horse in beef meat within one hour

items.title: Study challenges perception that empathy erodes during medical school
items.summary: A new study by social neuroscientists challenges the common perception that empathy declines during medical training.

alternate.title: Study challenges perception that empathy erodes during medical school
